3:
You return man to dust,
\q and you say, "Return, you descendants of mankind."
\q
4:
For a thousand years in your sight
\q are as yesterday when it is past,
\q and as a watch in the night.
6:
In the morning it blooms and grows up;
\q in the evening it withers and dries up.
7:
Truly, we are consumed in your anger,
\q and in your wrath we are terrified.
\q
8:
You have set our iniquities before you,
\q our hidden sins in the light of your presence.
10:
Our years are seventy,
\q or even eighty if we are healthy;
\q but even our best years are marked by trouble and sorrow.
\q Yes, they pass quickly, and we fly away.
11:
Who knows the intensity of your anger,
\q and your wrath that is equal to the fear of you?
\q
12:
So teach us to consider our life
\q so that we might live wisely.
\q
13:
Turn back, Yahweh! How long will it be?
\q Have pity on your servants.
14:
Satisfy us in the morning with your covenant faithfulness
\q so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
\q
15:
Make us glad in proportion to the days you afflicted us
\q and to the years we have experienced trouble.
\q
16:
Let your servants see your work,
\q and let our children see your majesty.
